operations.ConfigureLogs: Changes the packaging group's properities to configure log subscription
operations.CreateAsset: Creates a new MediaPackage VOD Asset resource.
operations.CreatePackagingConfiguration: Creates a new MediaPackage VOD PackagingConfiguration resource.
operations.CreatePackagingGroup: Creates a new MediaPackage VOD PackagingGroup resource.
operations.DeleteAsset: Deletes an existing MediaPackage VOD Asset resource.
operations.DeletePackagingConfiguration: Deletes a MediaPackage VOD PackagingConfiguration resource.
operations.DeletePackagingGroup: Deletes a MediaPackage VOD PackagingGroup resource.
operations.DescribeAsset: Returns a description of a MediaPackage VOD Asset resource.
operations.DescribePackagingConfiguration: Returns a description of a MediaPackage VOD PackagingConfiguration resource.
operations.DescribePackagingGroup: Returns a description of a MediaPackage VOD PackagingGroup resource.
operations.ListAssets: Returns a collection of MediaPackage VOD Asset resources.
operations.ListPackagingConfigurations: Returns a collection of MediaPackage VOD PackagingConfiguration resources.
operations.ListPackagingGroups: Returns a collection of MediaPackage VOD PackagingGroup resources.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Returns a list of the tags assigned to the specified resource.
operations.TagResource: Adds tags to the specified resource. You can specify one or more tags to add.
operations.UntagResource: Removes tags from the specified resource. You can specify one or more tags to remove.
operations.UpdatePackagingGroup: Updates a specific packaging group. You can't change the id attribute or any other system-generated attributes.

refs.HlsManifest$AdMarkers:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.
"SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35
messages in the input source.

AssetCreateParameters.base: Parameters used to create a MediaPackage VOD Asset.

AssetList.base: A collection of MediaPackage VOD Asset resources.

ConfigureLogsParameters.base: The configuration parameters for egress access logging.

DashEncryption.base: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) encryption configuration.

DashPackage.base: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) packaging configuration.

EgressEndpoint.base: The endpoint URL used to access an Asset using one PackagingConfiguration.

HlsEncryption.base: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) encryption configuration.

HlsManifest.base: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

HlsPackage.base: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) packaging configuration.

refs.DashManifest$ManifestLayout: Determines the position of some tags in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to FULL, elements like SegmentTemplate and ContentProtection are included in each Representation.  When set to COMPACT, duplicate elements are combined and presented at the AdaptationSet level.

MssEncryption.base: A Microsoft Smooth Streaming (MSS) encryption configuration.

MssManifest.base: A Microsoft Smooth Streaming (MSS) manifest configuration.

PackagingConfigurationCreateParameters.base: Parameters used to create a new MediaPackage VOD PackagingConfiguration resource.

PackagingConfigurationList.base: A collection of MediaPackage VOD PackagingConfiguration resources.

PackagingGroupCreateParameters.base: Parameters used to create a new MediaPackage VOD PackagingGroup resource.

PackagingGroupList.base: A collection of MediaPackage VOD PackagingGroup resources.

PackagingGroupUpdateParameters.base: Parameters used to update a MediaPackage packaging group.

refs.DashManifest$Profile: The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type.  When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled.

refs.DashPackage$SegmentTemplateFormat: Determines the type of SegmentTemplate included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to NUMBER_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.  When set to TIME_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Time$ media URLs. When set to NUMBER_WITH_DURATION, only a duration is included in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.

SpekeKeyProvider.base: A configuration for accessing an external Secure Packager and Encoder Key Exchange (SPEKE) service that will provide encryption keys.

refs.StreamSelection$StreamOrder: A directive that determines the order of streams in the output.

Tags.base: A collection of tags associated with a resource

refs.CmafPackage$IncludeEncoderConfigurationI: When includeEncoderConfigurationInSegments is set to true, MediaPackage places your encoder's Sequence Parameter Set (SPS), Picture Parameter Set (PPS), and Video Parameter Set (VPS) metadata in every video segment instead of in the init fragment. This lets you use different SPS/PPS/VPS settings for your assets during content playback.
refs.DashPackage$IncludeEncoderConfigurationI: When includeEncoderConfigurationInSegments is set to true, MediaPackage places your encoder's Sequence Parameter Set (SPS), Picture Parameter Set (PPS), and Video Parameter Set (VPS) metadata in every video segment instead of in the init fragment. This lets you use different SPS/PPS/VPS settings for your assets during content playback.
refs.HlsManifest$IncludeIframeOnlyStream: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.
refs.HlsManifest$RepeatExtXKey: When enabled, the EXT-X-KEY tag will be repeated in output manifests.
refs.HlsPackage$UseAudioRenditionGroup: When enabled, audio streams will be placed in rendition groups in the output.

refs.CmafPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds:
Duration (in seconds) of each fragment. Actual fragments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source fragment duration.
refs.DashManifest$MinBufferTimeSeconds: Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.
refs.DashPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds:
Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.
refs.HlsManifest$ProgramDateTimeIntervalSecon:
The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag
inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the
ingest time of the content.
If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then
no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective
of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,
it will be passed through to HLS output.
refs.HlsPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds:
Duration (in seconds) of each fragment. Actual fragments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source fragment duration.
refs.MssPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds: The duration (in seconds) of each segment.
refs.StreamSelection$MaxVideoBitsPerSecond: The maximum video bitrate (bps) to include in output.
refs.StreamSelection$MinVideoBitsPerSecond: The minimum video bitrate (bps) to include in output.

refs.AssetList$Assets: A list of MediaPackage VOD Asset resources.

refs.DashPackage$DashManifests: A list of DASH manifest configurations.

refs.Asset$EgressEndpoints: The list of egress endpoints available for the Asset.

refs.CmafPackage$HlsManifests: A list of HLS manifest configurations.
refs.HlsPackage$HlsManifests: A list of HLS manifest configurations.

refs.MssPackage$MssManifests: A list of MSS manifest configurations.

refs.PackagingConfigurationList$PackagingConf: A list of MediaPackage VOD PackagingConfiguration resources.

refs.PackagingGroupList$PackagingGroups: A list of MediaPackage VOD PackagingGroup resources.

refs.DashPackage$PeriodTriggers:
A list of triggers that controls when the outgoing Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH)
Media Presentation Description (MPD) will be partitioned into multiple periods. If empty, the content will not
be partitioned into more than one period. If the list contains "ADS", new periods will be created where
the Asset contains SCTE-35 ad markers.

refs.SpekeKeyProvider$SystemIds: The system IDs to include in key requests.

refs.TagsModel$Tags: A collection of tags associated with a resource

refs.Asset$CreatedAt: The time the Asset was initially submitted for Ingest.
refs.Asset$Id: The unique identifier for the Asset.
refs.Asset$PackagingGroupId: The ID of the PackagingGroup for the Asset.
refs.Asset$ResourceId: The resource ID to include in SPEKE key requests.
refs.Asset$SourceArn: ARN of the source object in S3.
refs.Asset$SourceRoleArn: The IAM role_arn used to access the source S3 bucket.
refs.AssetCreateParameters$Id: The unique identifier for the Asset.
refs.AssetCreateParameters$PackagingGroupId: The ID of the PackagingGroup for the Asset.
refs.AssetCreateParameters$ResourceId: The resource ID to include in SPEKE key requests.
refs.AssetCreateParameters$SourceArn: ARN of the source object in S3.
refs.AssetCreateParameters$SourceRoleArn: The IAM role ARN used to access the source S3 bucket.
refs.AssetList$NextToken: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.
refs.AssetShallow$CreatedAt: The time the Asset was initially submitted for Ingest.
refs.AssetShallow$Id: The unique identifier for the Asset.
refs.AssetShallow$PackagingGroupId: The ID of the PackagingGroup for the Asset.
refs.AssetShallow$ResourceId: The resource ID to include in SPEKE key requests.
refs.AssetShallow$SourceArn: ARN of the source object in S3.
refs.AssetShallow$SourceRoleArn: The IAM role ARN used to access the source S3 bucket.
refs.Authorization$CdnIdentifierSecret: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the secret in AWS Secrets Manager that is used for CDN authorization.
refs.Authorization$SecretsRoleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that allows MediaPackage to communicate with AWS Secrets Manager.
refs.CmafEncryption$ConstantInitializationVec: An optional 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks. If you don't specify a value, then MediaPackage creates the constant initialization vector (IV).
refs.DashManifest$ManifestName: An optional string to include in the name of the manifest.
refs.EgressEndpoint$PackagingConfigurationId: The ID of the PackagingConfiguration being applied to the Asset.
refs.EgressEndpoint$Url: The URL of the parent manifest for the repackaged Asset.
refs.HlsEncryption$ConstantInitializationVect:
A constant initialization vector for encryption (optional).
When not specified the initialization vector will be periodically rotated.
refs.HlsManifest$ManifestName: An optional string to include in the name of the manifest.
refs.MssManifest$ManifestName: An optional string to include in the name of the manifest.
refs.PackagingConfigurationList$NextToken: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.
refs.PackagingGroup$DomainName: The fully qualified domain name for Assets in the PackagingGroup.
refs.PackagingGroupList$NextToken: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.
refs.SpekeKeyProvider$RoleArn:
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that AWS Elemental
MediaPackage will assume when accessing the key provider service.
refs.SpekeKeyProvider$Url: The URL of the external key provider service.
